task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the target zone, approach the block, align the circular end-effector, push the block along a straight path toward the target, verify final alignment near the target outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a red T-shaped block across a planar workspace until it reaches a marked target outline on the board. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception of both block and target, safe approach with alignment, and straight-line pushing with a set yaw to keep contact along the stem of the T. The sequence includes retries for perception, repeated short pushes to control motion, a final alignment near the goal, and a retreat to leave the scene clear.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-shaped block and the target outline
End-effector is free and above the plane
Cameras provide sufficient view of block and target
stepwise_plan: Perceive the T-block and the target zone; retry if not visible
Move above the block and align the tool for pushing
Set yaw to align push direction
Execute three short pushes toward the target
Re-align near the target outline and verify placement
success_criteria: Block overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance
No toppling or loss of contact during pushing
Robot retreats to a safe standoff
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-scan in spiral/grid patterns
Drift during push: repeated short pushes with re-alignment
Contact lost: re-approach and resume push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is aligned at the target and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Clear tool–block contact with alignment intent visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Subsequent frames should show continued push along same direction.

frame_5.now_evidence: Mid-push with sustained contact near the T-stem.
frame_5.predicts_next: Completion of push or fine alignment near target.

frame_2.now_evidence: Robot close to block positioning for contact.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-block is visible.
Active search for the block when not visible.
Checks if the target zone is visible.
Search pattern to find the target outline.
Moves to a safe height above the block.
Approach the block and align for pushing.
Orient tool to push along a fixed direction.
Short push primitive; repeated to control motion.
Fine alignment near the target after pushing.
Back off to a safe standoff.

recovery_strategy: Use multiple short pushes with fixed yaw
Retreat and re-plan if drift exceeds tolerance
assumptions: Frames show a red T and a blue outline; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) partially mismatch. Mapped to symbolic names 't_block' and 'target_zone'.
Exact push direction inferred from frames; set to 90° for a rightward push.
10Hz observation/control noted but not mapped to specific timeout bins in the library.

expected_success_criteria: Block overlaps target outline after repeated pushes
